alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Douglas; Kandiyohi; Lac Qui Parle; Pope; Redwood; Renville; Stevens; Swift; Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 3:33AM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...DANGEROUSLY COLD WIND CHILLS THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... .Dangerous wind chills are expected to last through Tuesday morning, with widespread values of 25 to 35 degrees below zero. A Wind Chill Warning is in effect for western Minnesota through Monday morning. A Wind Chill Advisory is in effect for eastern Minnesota and western Wisconsin through Monday morning. After Monday morning, Wind Chill Advisories continue across western and central Minnesota through Tuesday morning. Wind Chill Advisories return for the Twin Cities metro and western Wisconsin this evening. ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central, southwest and west central Minnesota. * WHEN...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. For the Wind Chill Warning, from midnight tonight to noon CST Monday. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from noon Monday to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
